sub_topic: Calculating the volume of a rectangular pyramid.
message_1: A rectangular pyramid has a base area of 25 square meters and a height of 10 meters. Calculate the volume of the rectangular pyramid.
message_2:
To calculate the volume of a pyramid, we use the formula:

Volume = (1/3) × Base Area × Height

Given that the base area is 25 square meters and the height is 10 meters, we can plug these values into the formula:

Volume = (1/3) × 25 × 10

Volume = (1/3) × 250

Volume = 250/3

Volume ≈ 83.33 cubic meters

The volume of the rectangular pyramid is approximately 83.33 cubic meters.
